intro: Michelia elliptilimba, commonly known as the narrow-leaf michelia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Monimiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern China and is characterized by its elliptical, narrow leaves. The plant produces fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring, adding ornamental value to gardens. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its aesthetic appeal and ecological importance, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
